org.jgentleframework.core.provider
Interface ChildServiceListener

public interface ChildServiceListener

Represents the Child Service Listener that allows for custom behaviour when each child service of a specified Domain is added or removed.

Author:
LE QUOC CHUNG - mailto: skydunkpro@yahoo.com
See Also:
Domain, DomainManager

Method Summary
 void childrenAdded(java.util.Iterator<?> childrenAffected, Domain domain, ObjectBeanService objBeanService)
          The implementation of this method will be invoked automatically when each service is added to current domain.
 void childrenRemoved(java.util.Iterator<?> childrenAffected, Domain domain, ObjectBeanService objBeanService)
          The implementation of this method will be invoked automatically when each service is removed from current domain.
 

Method Detail

childrenAdded

void childrenAdded(java.util.Iterator<?> childrenAffected,
                   Domain domain,
                   ObjectBeanService objBeanService)
The implementation of this method will be invoked automatically when each service is added to current domain.

Parameters:
childrenAffected - all children services are affected by adding operation.
domain - the current domain
objBeanService - the corresponding ObjectBeanService of adding service.

childrenRemoved

void childrenRemoved(java.util.Iterator<?> childrenAffected,
                     Domain domain,
                     ObjectBeanService objBeanService)
The implementation of this method will be invoked automatically when each service is removed from current domain.

Parameters:
childrenAffected - all children services are affected by removing operation.
domain - the current domain
objBeanService - the corresponding ObjectBeanService of removing service.
